p: The p1 gene of strain M241 could not be amplified with PCR primers used for the analysis of M282 and K708 p1 genes. Because a large sequence change was expected at the 3′ end of M241 p1 gene, we designed several PCR primers that correspond to downstream of the p1 operon. Using one of these reverse primers, designated as 23e-R1, which was specific to the site about 2.5 kb downstream of the p1 operon (downstream of the orf6 gene), we achieved amplification of M241 p1 gene region. The PCR product size was about 6.8 kb shorter than expected ( S2 Fig). Sequencing of the PCR product revealed that a 6.8-kb deletion occurred in the p1 operon of M241 strain due to DNA recombination between the RepMP2/3 region in the p1 gene and another RepMP2/3 located downstream of the p1 operon (GenBank accession no. LC390171). This deletion caused a loss of the ADH4 primer binding site and entire orf6 gene ( S2 Fig). As expected from these results (truncation of the 3′ end of the p1 gene and loss of the orf6 gene), strain M241 had no cytadherence activity in the conventional hemadsorption assay [ 27, 28].
